titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller (Nelson A.) photographs, Vice Presidential, Series 6
A Guide to the Nelson A. Rockefeller photographs, Vice Presidential, Series 6 FA459

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-09-19 00:04:26 -0400.

revisiondesc.item: Imported into the Archivistsâ€™ Toolkit by Aurexus and Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller photographs, Vice Presidential, Series 6

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: United States. Office of the Vice President.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: For other Nelson A. Rockefeller photographic holdings, please see the following finding aids:

p.extref: FA454 Nelson A. Rockefeller photographs, Nelson A. Rockefeller family, Series 1008
FA455 Nelson A. Rockefeller photographs, Room 5600, Rockefeller family office, Series 2
FA456 Nelson A. Rockefeller photographs, Gubernatorial Press Office, Series 3
FA457 Nelson A. Rockefeller photographs, Gubernatorial Press Office, Series 4
FA458 Nelson A. Rockefeller photographs, Gubernatorial, Robert A. (Bob) Wands, Series 5
FA460 Nelson A. Rockefeller photographs, Unprocessed photographs, Series 7

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Permission is required in order to publish or otherwise use photographs and other visual materials of living members of the Rockefeller family. See RAC Head of Reference for details.
Images of Happy Rockefeller while she is officially serving as the Second Lady of the United States are open for scholarly use.
RAC users must abide by all applicable provisions of United States copyright law.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note
phystech.p: Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be closed to research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be closed to researchers at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/Head of Reference.
Photographic negatives cannot be handled or viewed by researchers due to the fragile nature of the format. To request duplication of an image(s), please contact an Archivist.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The Nelson A. Rockefeller photographs are arranged in the following series:

Series 1008: Nelson A. Rockefeller family. Series 2: Room 5600, Rockefeller family office. Series 3: Gubernatorial Press Office. Series 4: Gubernatorial Press Office. Series 5: Gubernatorial, Robert A. (Bob) Wands. Series 6: Vice Presidential. Series 7: Unprocessed photographs.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Prints are open for scholary access. Negatives are restricted from scholarly access.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Rockefeller family photographic holdings are arranged into the following series:

Rockefeller family and Avery family photographs, Series 1001. William Avery Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1002. John D. Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1003. William Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1004. John D. Rockefeller Jr. family photographs, Series 1005. Pocantico Hills photographs, Series 1006. John D. Rockefeller 3rd family photographs, Series 1007. Nelson A. Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1008. Laurance S. Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1009. David Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1010.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: For other Rockefeller family photographic holdings, please see the following finding aids:

controlaccess.corpname: United States. Office of the Vice President.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Each contact sheet and corresponding negative has been assigned an alphanumeric number G0001-G0199 and G1000-G2599. The material is arranged by the alphanumeric number. Since the alphanumerics are presented in sequence, this arrangement is also chronological -- beginning in December 1973 and spanning through 1976.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Contact sheets are currently housed in numbered binders - Volume 1 through Volume 16.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: There is also an incomplete second set of binders, Volume 2-14 and Volume 16. The volume numbers do not match the first set.

Contents of the second set: Volume 2 - G1100-G1199. Volume 3 - G1200-G1299. Volume 4 - G1300-G1399. Volume 5 - G1400-G1499. Volume 6 - G1500-G1599. Volume 7 - G1600-G1699. Volume 8 - G1700-G1799. Volume 9 - G1800-G1899. Volume 10 - G1900-G1999. Volume 11 - G2000-G2099. Volume 12 - G2100-G2199. Volume 13 - G2200-G2299. Volume 14 - G2300-G2399. Volume 16 - G2400-.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Negatives are restricted from scholarly access. Negatives may be accessed by RAC staff only.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Negatives remain in their original housing -- non-archival record storage cartons and envelopes.
